metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6323 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The makecontext function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before2.25 creates execution contexts incompatible with the unwinder on ARM EABI(32-bit) platforms, which might allow context-dependent attackers to causea denial of service (hang), as demonstrated by applications compiled usinggccgo, related to backtrace generation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.10').
